alert.note: Alert for Perry (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 2:53PM CST until March 08 at 12:27PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Houston. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the Arkansas River and up into the Fourche LaFave begin to flood. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CST Monday the stage was 27.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday morning. However, additional rainfall is expected later this week. Continue to monitor latest forecasts for any updates. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Houston 25.0 27.5 Mon 2 PM 23.8 22.7 22.4 *Falling* &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
